title: 107_hr3285
content: The Act may be cited as the "Federal-Local Information Sharing Partnership Act of 2001" and grants authority to share grand jury information. Rule 6(e)(3)(C) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure is amended to allow sharing of information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure are amended to allow sharing information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision, in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 3. AUTHORITY TO SHARE ELECTRONIC, WIRE, AND ORAL INTERCEPTION INFORMATION. Section 2517(6) of title 18, United States Code is amended to allow sharing of information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 4. FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE INFORMATION. Section 203(d)(1) of the USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision to receive and use national security information. Law enforcement personnel at the state or local level can receive and utilize national security information, following guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 5. DISCLOSURES TO GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES FOR COUNTERTERRORISM PURPOSES. Section 626(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to allow disclosure of consumer report information to law enforcement personnel for official duties. Law enforcement personnel must use the information in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General. Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of State to provide copies of visa and permit records to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official purposes. The Secretary of State can provide visa and permit records to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official purposes, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 7 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition. SEC. 8 pertains to information obtained from physical searches. SEC. 8 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition from physical searches. Amendment to the General Education Provisions Act allows disclosure of education records to state law enforcement personnel for official duties, with guidelines on information use. SEC. 10. INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF TERRORISM. Section 408(c)(1)(B) of the National Education Statistics Act of 1994 is amended to allow for the disclosure of reports, records, and information to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official duties, with guidelines on the use of the information.
